column1: vacuum_tube_desc;The vacuum tube (also known as the thermionic valve) is a device that utilizes the flow of current through a vacuum. In a vacuum tube electrons travel via thermionic emission (the Edison Effect) from a hot filament (negative cathode) through the vacuum to a positive electrode (the anode). Additional electrodes were later interposed between the anode and cathode
column2: enabling amplification and switching of signals. Vacuum tubes were essential to the production and commercialization of radio

column6: and early computers;;Die Vakuumröhre (auch Elektronenröhre genannt) ist ein Gerät
